Title:
Morphological characters and phylogenetic analysis reveal a
new species within the Inonotus linteus complex from China
Abstract:
Based on phylogenetic studies, the Inonotus linteus
complex has been recently divided in two new genera, Sanghuangporus and
Tropicoporus. Several species were transferred to the genus
Sanghuangporus, which have perennial, effused-reflexed to pileate
basidiocarps, a dimitic tramal hyphal system, and a very wide zone of
climatic environment. In this study, we have analyzed a large sample of
specimens from this complex, and Sanghuangporus quercinus sp. nov,
treated previously as Sanghuangporus baumii, was identified as a new
species from East Asia based on morephological and phylogenetic data.
Morphologically, it is characterized by perennial, resupinate to
effused-reflexed basidiocarps, a heterogeneous hyphal system with a
monomitic context and a dimitic hymenophoral trama, and broadly
subglobose to ovoid, thick-walled basidiospores 3-3.9 × 2.4-2.8 μm.
Phylogenetically, the status of S. quercinus was strongly supported by
phylogenetic analyses of nuclear internal transcribed spacer regions
(ITS) sequences.
